Reviews.Title: Excellent if you don't skimp on the SD card
Reviews.Author: Rod Reidnauer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent compact digital camera.  After my Fuji MX600ZOOM finally called it quits after 10 years, I chose the Canon A2000-IS after a pretty extensive search.  Pictures are excellent, macro works incredibly well, video is clear and smooth as my video camera, and it's so nice to have a 6X optical camera that will easily fit in my shirt pocket.Some complained about poor write speeds, and I can tell you at max resolution, max picture size, it takes just about 2 seconds for mine to write.  The reason is, I didn't skimp on the SD card.  I bought Sandisk's 20 MB/s SDHC in 8 GB size. ($47, but $20 rebate)  I almost went for their 30 MB/s card ($67) but I figureed 20 was fast enough for me.  Now if you stick a $12 Walmart special in, then yea, it will take a while to write the photo to it.In closing, i your looking for a high quality compact digital camera, you won't go wrong with this one as long as you don't feed it crappy SD cards.

Reviews.Title: Right for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I think this camera deserves four stars. I have used at least 10 digital cameras in the past 10 years, not counting the SLRs.  At this price, $249, I think what this camera offers is as good as you can get from a pocket camera.  There are some pros and cons but the pros far outweigh the cons.  I like the A2000's solid feel and weight, unlike the flimsy feel of the most other recent A series, such as my A570is.  The pictures are as good as, if not better than, any pocket camera at this price.  There are complaints about noise, but again find me better pictures from the same class of cameras.The features, however, are what please me. I am not going to repeat them since it's on the product description, but the use of AA batteries and 6x zoom are must haves for me.  For better pictures quality, I use my SLR, but for pocket convenience, I'll just enjoy this for the time being, until the technology catches up with our unquenchable taste.-----Added------After using it for a while, I couldn't understand how anyone would rate this camera lower than 3 stars without good reasons.  Try [...] for a fair review.

Reviews.Title: A2000IS Great new camera
Reviews.Author: Inna Yakobson "Innusik"
Reviews.Content: I bought this new Canon A2000IS camera right after it was issued (September 2008)for my China trip. It replaced my old Canon A470, which got wet on Iguassu Falls, Brazil and as a result got a problem with full opening lens.First of all, new camera has perfect 6X zoom and of cause very convenient big 3" screen. It works just great even compare with higher  class and much more expensive cameras by another brands. A few people of our tour group made pictures at the same conditions (for example on acrobats show) using different type of cameras. My photos were the best, even without flush and far from the stage.Yes, you have to wait a few seconds to recharge the flush, but it compensates with using just 2 AA batteries (you always have spare).By the way, I am using Sony rechargeable battery (thanks for one of Amazon reviewer)and it works perfect for quite long time and hundreds of pictures made even in the night.So if you are not so picky and not professional, but average user,like me, it is a really great camera for universal purposes. I am very satisfied  with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pocket camera
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after trying the latest pocket Nikon, the L20.  I found the menus on the L20 a little frustrating and the colors recorded in dim light (outdoor twilight) to be a little off.  I also have a Canon SX10 which I have been very pleased with, so I thought I would try one of the Canon pocket offerings and I have indeed been pleased.  I'll give the usual pros and cons:Pros:Takes great shots on the auto setting.The optical image stablization works excellent even on maximum zoom.  I shot quite a few indoor photos at full zoom and about 90% came out great.  Granted, it was pretty brightly lit indoors, but previous cameras I've owned usually wound up with blurry photos.The dial on the top makes it easy to flip between different shooting modes.  I was surprised how much I liked having this dial vs. the Nikon L20 which is all menu-driven.The camera survived a drop from about 4' onto cement without a scratch or any internal damage.  And no, I didn't do that on purpose. ;)The camera takes AA batteries which I have always liked - great when traveling.The display on the back is large and easy to see even in bright light.The 6x zoom lens is great.The battery life is great.  I shot about 140 shots, some of them with flash, and the "low battery" light didn't even come on.Cons:It's awfully big for a pocket camera.  It just barely fits in my front pocket.  It may not seem much bigger than the Nikon L20, but when you hold it in your hand you realize it's a fair bit heavier and noticeably larger.The flash does take a long time to recharge, depending on the strength it used in the previous photo.  I have read numerous other reviews stating the same thing.  It's about what you would expect from a AA-powered camera.Lastly, it's not as sexy-looking as other offerings from Nikon.  All they would have to do is paint it red... oh well.Final thoughts:I have own some Kodak pocket-sized AA cameras before and found them generally poorly-made.  So, I ruled them out on this purchase.  I also looked at an Olympus, but in the end went with the Canon and have not been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: Amazon was great!  Said "shipment" in 1-4 weeks (plus delivery time); actually, it was "delivered" in 9 days (using free saver shipping).  Plus, their price was $10 less than the featured vendor.Got this camera after much research, to complement my "big" ultra-zoom.  Needed something that used AA batts, SD cards, decent zoom, enuf program functions/features, yet small to fit in my shirt pocket.  The Canon A2000 is perfect.  The size/weight and wedge shape are right for one-handed usage (the smaller ones are harder to hold).  And, I like the solid feel and construction.Would have prefered an EVP viewfinder in addition to the 3" LCD, but since Canon only has an optical VF (on the A1000), it didn't bother me to lose it.  Yes, it's a little hard to see the LCD at angles, but enuf of the image is visible to know what you're framing, and between the IS and sensors, the exposure/focus is fine.  Bright sunlight is also an issue with the LCD, but again, enuf is visible.  This is not a $300+ camera; given it's $160 price, it's awesome!Regarding the delay time, I have not experienced any problem (using rechargeable 2650 mha batts).  Non-flash shots are virtually 1 sec delay; continuous mode shots are about 1/2 sec apart, flash shots are about 3 sec delay.  Often, the only problem is that you need to adjust many of the default settings - reduce image to 6MB & Fine, IS to "shoot" not "continuous", reduce the review time, etc.  Oh, and I'm using just a "standard" SD card.The quik-use functions (ISO, flash, drive mode) are very easily accessible.  The Macro/Landscape quik-access is very handy to have.  The AEL and AFL are very handy and easy to use (after you read the manual to find out how), and I programed the print button to use WB.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Pleased
Reviews.Author: Leo
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my wife for Mothers day. She wanted a camera that was easy to use and took good pictures. I on the other hand, wanted a little more out of the camera. I looked at several and came up with this one. I like several features including the batteries you can dump and reload on the go. Don't have to plug in and charge. Battery life is good too, better if you use Energizer e2's (No Plug, Just Fact!). I also like the Optical zoom, have not seen a lot of cameras this size have a good optical zoom, just digital. Features take some playing with to get used to but what new device doesn't. Bottom line is that my wife can put it on AUTO and shoot nice pictures, and I can change all the settings on PROGRAM mode and do the same. The only down side I can think of is that it IS SMALLER than the one I previously had, so it will take some adjusting for the size factor. I definitely use the wrist strap all the time. All in all, it's a very nice camera, I was even thinking about getting one for myself because my wife wants hers back!Update: I liked this camera and probably would still be using it if my curious little 3 year old didn't find it and decide that the lens should be pushed in when the motor pushed it out. It would have cost more to fix it than buying another one. But it was a nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: blackie "b."
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures and videos, but it has one big problem: It takes around 5 seconds to load the picture you just took, making it a slow camera.With the cameras outhere nowadays, this sort of thing shouldn't happen.It is definitely disappointing to have to wait so long to see the picture you just took, and to have to wait so long to actually take another picture. This happens only using the flash, so at least you won't have this problem during the day.The other minor problem is that it is way too big.. it is not a pocket camera that's for sure. If you're looking for a small camera don't buy this one.Aside from those problems, the camera is very good, your typical cannon camera.

Reviews.Title: Superb value & Quick Reload
Reviews.Author: Uncle Willy "Uncle Willy"
Reviews.Content: I set out to find an affordable digital that had a quick reload.  If there is one thing I cannot stand is missing a shot because my camera was still writing to the card.  Luckly, those days are behind me.  The new Canon A2000 is awesome in that department!  Bear in mind, I am also using SDHC cards - and I know... I read a lot of reviews about whether one should spend the extra money on SDHC.  But the combination of the Canon A2000 and SDHC cards has me ready to reshoot in just seconds.  The large viewer is perfect, and of course, a lengendary Canon lens!  In my opinion, this camera is a deal at this price!

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera
Reviews.Author: Christophe J. Grimes "chrisg1711"
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera.It has plenty of adjustments to use if you need them. The others that complain must want to make dozens of adjustments before making a picture. That was one of the main reasons for purchasing this camera,being simple; yet can do alot of things you find in more expensive cameras. To the people that complain; if you want to adjust shutter speed,IR,variable lens,etc... go and buy a more expensive camera! This one is great and takes great pictures! The 6x lens is magnificent.The 10mgp produces great high quality pictures. I love this camera! After reading other reviews about the batteries, I decided to go with Canon's charger, the CBK4-300.It cost alot more, but the reviews were the best on this charger for a Canon camera. Accessorized with bigger GB memory card,Canon camera case and a SDHC card reader; so as not to have to use my cameras batteries while downloading to computer. I am a very happy camper with this camera.

Reviews.Title: I had high hopes but am very disappointed
Reviews.Author: BTX
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this Canon A2000 IS because I really love the convenience of using a camera that takes easily available batteries, instead of one that needs to be constantly recharged. I was also looking forward to this model because Canon reduced the size, and for me, the smaller and lighter, the better.Unfortunately, Canon needs to go back to the drawing board.The camera is oddly shaped...shaped like a wedge. I dislike this wedge shape. The picture on Amazon doesn't show the wedge shape. You have to be looking down on the top or the bottom to see it.I don't really like the way the camera feels while holding it. It's not as good as some of the other A Series. The camera also feels heavier than I thought it would feel, based on the description. I expected the camera to be lighter in weight and easier to carry in my pocket.I am disappointed with the flash recharge time between shots. There is a good chance you will miss an important shot occasionally while waiting for the flash to recharge.The zoom while shooting video with this camera is digital zoom, and the results are poor. If you use the zoom, you won't be able to read words or see some things clearly. I recommend not using the zoom when recording video.Digital still pictures are the same quality you expect with this type of Canon Point & Shoot Camera, as long as you shoot at the low ISO. Once you try to shoot in low light or at a higher ISO, the typical noise level is there. I was hoping that Canon would have improved their image sensor on their $250 cameras by now, but they have not.The 6X Optical Zoom while shooting still pictures is great.Macro mode for very close up shots is great.The 3" LCD screen is very nice and clear (unless you are outside in bright sunlight, of course).Conclusion: If you really desire a camera that accepts alkaline batteries, put the A2000 IS on your list. If the battery issue is not important to you, I would avoid this camera. In my opinion, if Canon or any other company releases a better camera that takes alkaline batteries, you will dump this camera in a second. (I know I will.) I guess this means that this can be your temporary AA-battery-operated camera until something better comes along. If you already own a camera that you are happy with, this camera is not going to make you happier, and there is no need to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Does everything I wanted it to.
Reviews.Author: BHL
Reviews.Content: After A LOT of comparison shopping I decided to purchase the Powershot A2000is.  The 6X optical zoom was the deciding factor.  I wanted something small and relatively inexpensive but with good resolution and zoom.  This fit the bill perfectly.  It takes sharp photos no matter where I've taken pictures, inside, at the beach in a darkened room.I've owned Canon's before so I was already familiar with the controls and settings but they are very easy to use.  I've shown my tech challenged friend how to operate it and she has done so with flying colors.I have found the battery life acceptable and have not experienced the "lag" between shots that some other reviewers have had.My only complaint, if you can call it that, is the camera is a little heavy.  But I will take it for all of the other positives.

Reviews.Title: From A720IS to A2000, it's still better
Reviews.Author: Due Tomorrow
Reviews.Content: As an owner of an A720IS and recently bought the A2000IS, I much prefer the A2000.  By and far, it's not perfect, but what digital camera really is?There's a complaint about the wedge shape, but the camera is far smaller than the previous A series, which has an even more unusual shape that makes it bulky and very difficult to fit in most compact digital camera bags (which for the A2000 is a TON easier, not to mention easier to fit in a pocket).  I'd take smaller and unusual but sleeker over larger, bulky, and awkward.Another complaint was the flash recycle time; what do you expect with AA batteries?  When the A series used 4 AA batteries, I'm sure this wasn't as much of an issue, but the camera was ridiculously huge and heavy.  If you want smaller recycle times, go buy a camera with Lithium-Ion batteries.  The A2000 had at worst a little longer recycle time than the A720, but I've learned to live with it; I have to be a little more careful with my shots rather than just shooting away as if I had a SLR.With that professional reviewer, I think he's being a bit nitpicky.  I had no problems with the dial, as I use all the settings, including the manual modes very often.  Unless you want perfection...well, let's be honest, if you want a monster camera, you should be looking for a SLR.The short of it: I love my A720IS, but the size is a huge burden. If you can live with the longer flash recycle times than the SD series (which I've gotten used to, I'm sure you can too), and can take care of your camera (I don't recommend this for a teenager that'll slap this around) this is really a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Go for it
Reviews.Author: Audrey A. Ingram
Reviews.Content: I'd read several reviews on this camera before I bought it. Though there is a slight delay between the button and the shutter, it's nothing more than you'd get used to with any other camera.  I have been very pleased-I took it on a mission trip and to several concerts-my pictures are very clear and detailed and my video recordings are excellent. I woud definitely reccommend this product-it's also priced low for the amount of megapixels and zoom.  It's a great buy :)

Reviews.Title: great quality and easy to use
Reviews.Author: B. Lowery
Reviews.Content: After years of lugging the 35mm and all of the film and lenses around, I finally moved into the 20th century and bought a digital camera!  What a pleasure!  It's light and compact and the zoom capabilities are great.  It takes good, clear pictures under most circumstances.  Some of the preset settings (fireworks and night settings) did not work well for me, but this is a new camera and I have not had a lot of time to play with the ISO and other settings.  Shots taken in the auto setting were generally good.  Although I plan to purchase a more sophisticated camera that will accept my 35mm camera lenses, I know that this Powershot A2000 will continue to get a lot of use.Positives far outnumber the negatives -Only negatives (and they are minor):It burns through batteries pretty quickly - especially if you don't get the longer lasting ones.  I take them out between uses and this seems to help some.It also takes a long time to reset between shots to be ready to take the next shot.  I will try a faster memory card to see if this helps.All in all, I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew Crish
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a 7-year old 3.2 MP digital point-and-shoot.  I researched a lot of cameras in the $100-$300 price range, and what kept drawing me back to this one was the 6x optical zoom.  I liked my old camera, but 3x optical zoom just wasn't enough.  Soon after I got this camera, I took it on a vacation to Paris, and the pictures turned out great!  It does take a little time to "re-load" in between pictures, but for the amateur who is just looking for a quality camera at a great price, you can't go wrong with this camera.  In fact, my in-laws just bought the same camera after seeing what this one can do.  I also viewed the simplicity as a positive (I know alot of experienced photgraphers don't like the lack of manual settings).  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: S. Johns
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have taken it to two different concerts recently and the 6x zoom has come in very handy. The kids/pets setting is my favorite for fast moving things. The pictures I have taken with the night snapshot also turned out great. I have also taken a lot of short videos on it too. As long as I get the camera to focus when I start the video they come out great. I love the size of the LCD screen as well. It is very easy to use and I can't stop taking picture since I got it. I would recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: This Camera is Reefers Best Friend
Reviews.Author: Lam T. Lam "D34532"
Reviews.Content: Canon got it just right.  I got this camera for pretty much for the sole reason for use of taking pictures of saltwater fish tank, where MH, T5, and other lighting source that is blue.  Many other camera have options that you have to play around with to get the white balance correct.  Canon has a "custom" white balance that is a matter of a click of a button and it auto adjust.  Ive taken this camera to 2 local fish(reef) store and they were sold on it and wanted to know where they can buy one.  As many reefers know great true image of your livestock sell your corals and this camera paid for itself.

Reviews.Title: My disappointment is so high
Reviews.Author: W. Lawless
Reviews.Content: I am very sorry I bought the new Canon A2000 camera. I will be giving the camera to my nephew, since my disappointment is so high. I cannot express my frustration level at the amount of time it takes for the flash to recharge and at Canon for even bothering to release such an inferior "A" series replacement. I implore upon Canon to go back to the drawing board on this one.I read all of the reviews on Amazon and I have to respond directly to that one review where the reviewer foolishly tries to justify his positive review based on the review of a camera-review Website.One other reviewer responded in the comments section to said review, but his or her reply won't be seen in the general review section, so I will paste in what he or she said here.(These are excerpts from a professional camera reviewer.)"The A2000 is a bit of a new departure for the A-series. Previous models in the range have been popular with hobbyists and more experienced photographers, thanks to their robust construction, excellent handling, limited but useful range of manual exposure controls and optical viewfinders. The A2000 has none of these things, and appears to be aimed at less ambitious photographers looking not for manual versatility but for a simple, easy-to-use general-purpose compact. If this represents a new direction for the A-series then there will be some disappointed customers."The body is made of plastic, and although the camera does feel solidly weighty, the body panels seem to be thinner than previous A-series cameras and creak alarmingly when squeezed. There's nothing really wrong with it, but it does feel more cheaply made than some previous models in the range."The A2000 has no optical viewfinder, but it does have an enormous three-inch LCD monitor. However this too is not up to the high standard of previous A-series models. It has an extremely narrow viewing angle of only about 30-odd degrees vertically, making it difficult to use for over-the-head shots, and it is also highly reflective. It's the first Canon monitor in a long time that I've actually had difficulty using outdoors."Main shooting mode is controlled via a large dial on the camera's top panel. The dial itself feels a bit cheap and clunky, with distinct air of Fisher Price about it."The menu on the A2000 appears to be similar to some of the recent IXUS range, with fewer options than usual for an A-series camera."The external controls don't appear to be as solidly mounted as they might be, and some feel decidedly flimsy. Catch one with the edge of a fingernail and it gives an distinctly plastic `ping'."The zoom control is a rotary bezel around the shutter button. The control action is fairly crude; you have to turn the ring a long way to make it move, and when it does it moves jerkily and too quickly, making accurate framing difficult. Since the 6x zoom range is a major selling point of the camera I would have hoped that Canon might do a better job on the zoom control."Low light focusing is not as reliable as some other recent cameras."VerdictThe Canon PowerShot A2000 IS is a little expensive for a mid-level compact, and the overall build quality and low-angle monitor may cause some disappointment. The lack of the usual A-series manual exposure options and optical viewfinder may also put off some potential buyers."Yes, the review listed many positives, but with so many negatives, you can clearly see why many people would give this camera some low star ratings. Also, the low star reviews are a reflection of the huge disappointment with Canon regarding their latest A model. They could have and should have done better. They are charging $250, and it is 2008, and the flash recharge time is unacceptable. Also, when considering reviews, you have to take into consideration that one might be trying to help people decide if there are better cameras if one doesn't really care about the AA battery issue."I think the A2000 deserves the majority of low star ratings it has on Amazon as of today. Thank you."I agree with the above negatives and opinion. And I would concur that the A2000 deserves a lower star rating because the scale is different with this camera. The rating is on this latest "A" series replacement camera from Canon; a camera line that takes AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Lynn Brown "tombstoneguru"
Reviews.Content: Have only had this camera for a short period but it takes super clear pictures on the auto setting. Still have some learning to do to learn all the other options. The display is great and easy to see. I up graded the memory card to an 8GB card and it holds over 2,000 photographs!

Reviews.Title: After 3 years use
Reviews.Author: Junia
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately most reviews are written pretty soon after buying cameras.  My husband and i each have one of these bought about 6 months apart.  We loved them the first year for all the reasons mentioned by other reviewers.  Then fisrt mine and then my husband's started eating batteries.  after only a few pictures the battery warnng light would come on.  This happened sooner and sooner until we were only getting a couple of pictures on my camera before it flashed battery is low and shut down.  His is following the same pattern.  Batteries are only lasting for a few pictures.  Now the flash on his camera is not working at all.  With one I would say possible fluke but with 2??Anyone else have one you have used for a while?

Reviews.Title: one of my best purchases  ever!
Reviews.Author: loridavis
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at this little camera. I originally got for it for my son to learn photography -but am actually. Keeping it fir myself (lol)

Reviews.Title: A2000 IS Not Up to Expectations
Reviews.Author: D. Eagle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago specifically because it was advertised as capable of taking pictures in low light with no flash.  It is supposed to have an internal stablizer.  I was traveling to St. Petersburg and wanted to take pictures in the Hermitage Museum.  For this purpose it failed miserably.  Well over half were so blurry that they were worthless.  It was a once-in-a-lifetime trip which I will never be able to repeat.  Pictures taken in bright sunlight or with flash are good, but no better than any other digital camera.  There is no viewfinder so the only way to view the picture before taking it is the display on the back.  In bright sunlight it is impossible to see the image on the display.  The display drains the batteries in no time flat.The worst fault is the latch on the door for the battery compartment.  After a year of normal use it has loosened to the point where the batteries don't make contact unless the door is pressed shut.  So in order to take pictures I have a rubber band holding the door shut.I can say unequivocally it is the worst camera I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Camera was excellent, then quit with  'lens error'
Reviews.Author: EdG.
Reviews.Content: CANNON POWER SHOT A2000IS:  ~~  The camera work excellent for the first few times that I used it, I am not a big camera user, I used it for a couple birthday partys and one weekend trip so I have only used it about 6 or 7 times, then one day when I went to use it I put new batteries in it, turned it on, but the lens would not open. It displayed "lens error". Turning it on and off several times did not help anything, the lens will not open.I have never dropped the camera, never spilled any liquid on it and it has been well taken care of because it cose me well over $200.00 dollars. The camera still looks to be brand new. The camera is out of warrenty now. When I first bought it it took excellext pictures and I was very proud of it but now that it has quit working by no fault of mine I am verry dissappointed with Cannon products. I searched the internet and found that I am not alone with this 'lens error' problem and find that Cannon refuses to reconize this problem.This has upset me to the point that I will no longer purchase any products made by Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Only 1 'Real' Negative With It
Reviews.Author: J. Ford
Reviews.Content: I've owned and used a few other Canon point and shoot cameras.  Also own a nice Canon D-SLR.  Recently bought the A2000 for leisure use after looking at every other Canon point and shoot within the price range.Here are the PROS and CONS that I've found so far;PROS:- Not too small, not too big.  Can still fit in a (guys) pocket pretty easily.- LARGE screen. 3" is great! Most have 2.5"- Picture quality. This should be about the most important thing right?!- Ease of use.- 6x Optical Zoom.  Most cameras are only 3-4x Optical Zoom.CONS:#1 CON - LONG delay between pictures.  This may mean you miss a pic or two at times....eek!- Some smaller cameras out there...if that's what you're looking for.- Using the screen all the time means it's using your batteries quicker (vs. a viewfinder on other cameras)- Uses 2 AA batteries???...personally this doesn't bother me because I don't have to worry about every buying one of those expensive batteries that come with most other point and shoot cameras down the road.  I just bought 4 rechargables and now I'll have battery backups all the time and for A LOT less than the cost of the other batteries.BOTTOM LINE: Go to the store and take a picture or two with the camera.  If the delay between picture taking doesn't bother you and it seems like what you're looking for....buy it.  It's really a nice camera for the money besides the delay issue.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Russell "Rusty"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter, who attends college. I have been into 35MM photography for years and hadn't had much experience with any point and shoot camera. When it arrived we took it out together for its first run and I was very surprised just how good these little cameras do perform.The picture quality is excellent and the camera is a snap to use. Even in the easy mode it still took outstanding pictures. I have always considered myself a Canon man,since all five of my SLR's are Canons,but the A2000IS was even better than I imagined. I'm not recommending this camera to an experienced photographer who likes to set up his own shots,but to someone that is just starting out or someone that isn't into photography but just wants to take some good family snapshots,this would be a camera I would put high on my list.

Reviews.Title: Great price, great little machine
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Pakula "bimmergal"
Reviews.Content: This camera was top rated by Consumer Reports and Amazon had the best price. I can't wait to use it this fall when I got on a road trip. My son is a professional freelance photographer in Russia with an expensive digital camera and he was very impressed with the Powershot. I compared others in this price range and this one came out on top, easy to use and connect the software to my older computer.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Damian L. Moose "DemonMoose"
Reviews.Content: Excellent digital camera, the best camera I have ever owned, would recommend it to any one.

Reviews.Title: Top notch digital camera.
Reviews.Author: P. M. Spiegel
Reviews.Content: I'm a beginner at photography. Before buying, I did quite a bit of research. The camera works beautifully - it even has a "dummy" setting for beginners. The images are crisp and clear - insurance photos of my books showed all the titles clearly. The associated software works well on my Mac. I'm looking forward to entering the digital age of photography.

Reviews.Title: Solid semi-budget camera for general picture taking
Reviews.Author: Alexander ""The Weatherman""
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a vacation and used it for general point and shoot pictures. Have not yet going through the advanced options, but changing basic things like the ISO and flash are easy to get to once you actually take a look at the camera's back. It has a nice big screen on the back to view photos and the 6x zoom is plenty good enough.It takes AA batteries which is a plus or minus depending on your preference. You can choose to use rechargeable AAs if rechargeable is your style, but the freedom to use any old AA battery is a big plus. The battery lasted all 9 days while other cameras in our group had to be charged several times. The 2 AAs did die just after.Note that this camera does not come with any storage onboard, so lay down about 10-20 on an 8GB card so you can take all the full res photos and videos you want without space restriction.No complaints so far besides the photos being a little fuzzy when viewed at full size. A good simple camera with options for pretty cheap. Recommended for those looking for a simple camera to just take pictures without changing settings all the time. Point, shoot, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Another great Canon camera
Reviews.Author: C. Van Hest "Fishin' Fool"
Reviews.Content: This Powershot 2000IS was purchased as a birthday gift for my husband, to replace an older version of the same model.  He wanted the greater optical zoom feature.  The camera is easy to operate and takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Edwin
Reviews.Content: got camera well on time; was grad present; went over very!! well.  great for a new high school student, taking pictures and movies!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Denise Carnell "Denise"
Reviews.Content: Everything I want in a simple point and shoot camera!  Great at super close shots of small details!  Long battery life and the zoom is much better than my old camera.  I love the stabilization feature as I get much less blurry shots especially using the zoom. I can get really nice hummingbird pictures now!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Sherry Mumma
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  A little slow when trying to take consecutive photos with the flash on, but other than that good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera in this price range/category
Reviews.Author: J. Bennett "jbenn429"
Reviews.Content: easy to use, takes great pictures, in this price range/category you can't do any better..i did a lot of research.  I initially did not like the AA battery power source, but like very much now that I found good hybrid rechargeable batteries, though the shutter does lag moreso with this power source.  The zoom on this camera is awesome. the 3 inch view screen is nice in size, but very hard to see in the sun..even with setting on brightest setting and the resolution is just ok.  solid build quality, a little bigger than most cameras in this price range and does not fit in the hand that easy.  Besides these few minor gripes, i highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a quality point and shoot with a good zoom and 10 megapixels.

Reviews.Title: I found it!!!
Reviews.Author: S. FURLOW
Reviews.Content: I was looking to upgrade my old Canon digital camera and spent numerous hours and days searching online reviews and prices.  I am just a type of person looking for a good deal and getting the most bang for the buck.  I saw this camera and at the time had only 6 reviews and they were not good.  But I liked the features of this camera (6X optical zoom, 3" LCD, 10MP, and AA batteries).  Unless your a professional photographer or cry about every little thing because your looking for that dream camera that has everything, your going to like this camera.  It's very easy to use.  The people who gave this camera bad reviews are nit pickers.  Go ahead and read all the little things they are crying about and you will see my point.  I am very happy I made this purchase.  So quit looking for the perfect camera and buy this one.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: too big, slow, disappointing
Reviews.Author: phoopabriba
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Powershot A75 for four years now and have been very happy with it, even had a few photos from a trip to Mexico win some local awards and have several prints framed in my home.  On my birthday a few weeks ago, it quit working so I decided to buy a new one.  I did two weeks worth of research and finally decided on this one, largely because I trust the Canon brand.I read several negative reviews on this camera and decided to ignore them, since the A1000 gets better reviews and this is supposedly a step up.  I had looked at the A1000 in stores but decided to go with the 2000 for the 6x zoom.  However, I was surprised when I received it to see that it is LARGER than the A1000, which you can't tell from the pictures.  If you really want the 3" screen you may not mind, but this camera actually seemed bigger than my old A75 that takes four batteries.  I've always found my A75 to be on the large size, so I didn't care that much about having an ultra-compact camera, but I was not expecting it to actually be bigger.Also discovered that the flash recharge takes longer than my A75, I'm guessing because it takes two batteries instead of four.  I was also expecting a huge improvement in image stabilization and motion detection since I bought the A75 four years ago, but I still got blurry pictures of my cat indoors with no flash (she's white so flash always washes her out) but with plenty of light and set to "Kids and pets."  Maybe I'm just running up against the limits of a digital point and shoot, but I thought the technology would have improved more by now.Sent it back and decided to wait for the new Lumix DMC-FS15 that's coming out at the end of the month.  Smaller, faster, wide angle lens, and I love the option of extra optical zoom on the Panasonics.All in all, if you don't mind the larger size and the slower speed between shots with flash, then it might not be a bad camera.  I was very happy with the image quality of my A75.

Reviews.Title: Quality camera
Reviews.Author: Noelle of Notes "Kell"
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera. Canon is awesome, as I've always known them to be. The 6x optical zoom is great, then it goes digital zoom 6x more. The optical is great, but then it can be a bit iffy when it switches over to the digital zoom. It just gets a little blurry or pixeley and hard to hold steady. But that's understandable for digital zoom. But it really all depends on how far away you are from the object you're trying to zoom in on. Obviously, the closer the better. But really, the zoom overall is great!The setting options are cool too. It has settings for night scenes, outdoors, indoors, closeup shots, and I've enjoyed using all of them. The one setting I wish it had was panorama. But really, this is a great camera for a person who doesn't want too many bells and whistles and has a certain budget to follow, but would also want one of quality. This is a winner, all the way.The viewing screen is nice and big! I really like that feature. Though it doesn't have a viewfinder, I'm just fine with the screen. Viewfinders almost seem unneccessary these days. The only reason I'd think someone would want one is just in case their screen wasn't working or something. Or maybe there's something else I don't know.Overall, this is a wonderful, good quality camera. The pictures are nice and clear, the settings are great, and I would reccommend this to anybody!!!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera, womderful price
Reviews.Author: Wierd Beard "Beardy"
Reviews.Content: The canon A2000is is hands down a wonderful point and shoot camera.  The 6x zoom is wonderful for getting close up shots.  The convenience of AA batteries is comforting in the extreme (no hunting for outdated proprietary batteries on the internet in 5 years).  The documentation is fairly robust and understandable for a novice.  The LCD is large and is still viewable in very bright light.  The menu and modes are fairly simple to navigate, moreso if one reads some of the helpful reviews here.  Overall a great camera.  I'm extremely pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Nadeen L. Paradis "navsav"
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a camera expert, I do not know how the majority of the functions work on this camera - but I will say it takes outstanding photos.  There is no blurring even at the tighest zoom.  The image stabilizer works superb.  I mostly take photos of the kids and I have not had any problem with shutter speed or the time between taking pictures.  I had a Canon prior to this and this one is much better.  I am very happy with my camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice photos
Reviews.Author: B Husted
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for a few years. It still works well and has quite a few photo enhancing perks. I tend to just take photos on a manual setting. If I were a serious photographer I would want a higher zoom.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A2000IS 10MP Digital Camera with 6X Optical image
Reviews.Author: Rita Barton
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a new camera like this and loved it but dropped it in a lake. This "used" camera did not last long and I had  to buy a new camera. So much for "used"  cameras!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A20001S
Reviews.Author: Laurlie P
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smaller digital camera that would still have the clarity (10MP) and also a good zoom lense (6X).  This little Canon Powershot provided me with just that.  It seemed I never had my larger camera available whenever something came up that I wanted a picture of.  I checked Amazon and found this little Canon Powershot.  It takes excellent and clear pictures, and the 6X zoom lense brings in the scenary and wildlife shots to give me beautiful pictures.  I would recommend this camera to anyone with similar needs as it is small enough to carry in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Can't see nothing in bright sun light but your own reflection
Reviews.Author: Not a happy camper with canon
Reviews.Content: It is impossible to see any thing on the screen in bright sunlight but your own reflection. I have had a hood installed around the screen but it don't seem to help much. I fail to see what good a camera is that cannot be used out side in the sunlight. I missed a great once in a life time family picture on a trip to the coast as I couldn't see what I was taking and missed some of the family members. I was greatly disapointed as you can not see the review picture either in the sunlight. After getting indoors where I could finally see the picture it was to late to retake as some of the family had left. I would recomend that you find a different brand if you are looking to buy a camera.

Reviews.Title: Diminishing Performance?
Reviews.Author: InIreland
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about a year now.  Was very happy with it at first but lately it seems the pic quality isn't as good.  No matter what setting I use, pictures tend to look "flashed out" - not sure if this is some sort of light leak or - ?  The lag time between taking pics is the biggest drawback to this camera. VERY slow for sure. With regard to batteries, I use AA lithium and they last a very long time, so there's really no need for rechargeable.  I took pictures and video non-stop for 2 weeks on a trip to Ireland and never had to replace the batteries.This is my 3rd Canon camera. Seems to me that quality has gone FAR downhill and they have a lot of the same issues across the board - for example, as many people have complained on various models, I also had to return one of my Canonse because the lens wouldn't retract after several weeks of use.  Seems like this is not just a Canon problem but the way things are being made these days (i.e., in China!)  Bummer.

Reviews.Title: This is the best camera I've owned and it takes amazing pictures!
Reviews.Author: karmawizard
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing this item on Amazon, I owned a Sony Cypershot that I had for years, and I just figured it was time to get a new camera to take advantage of advancing technology. I'm so very glad I made the decision to purchase this camera. Although it is relatively inexpensive, it has taken some of the most beautiful pictures of any camera I've ever used, and it surpasses the picture quality of friends' cameras that cost substantially more money.One of the best things about this camera, in my opinion, is that unlike many cameras, it runs on two AA batteries. The downside to this is that there is a bit of a lag when taking pictures while the flash recharges, and it takes a few seconds to navigage between pictures on the camera in the picture-viewing mode. However, this also means that if your battery runs low, throw them out and put in a couple of AA's, which can be gotten without very much trouble almost anywhere. Whereas many cameras have a special type of battery that, when it dies, unless you have a spare ready, so much for your pictures. Granted, these other batteries may last longer and speed up flash recovery time, but you may miss out on pictures if your battery goes dead. With this one, just carry a couple extra AA's, which are cheap and available.Some reviewers said that they experienced problems with the lens not opening or sticking, or with the battery door being flimsy. Well, I've had this camera and have probably taken several hundred pictures with it over the last couple years. So far the lens has never stuck or failed to open. So perhaps they got a faulty model, but mine works wonderfully. As far as the battery door being flimsy plastic, I grant you that it's not the toughest plastic in the world, and if you drop it or abuse it and aren't careful, it may end up braking on you. So, just be careful with it, and you won't have any problem. Anything you use and abuse is breakable; under normal conditions you'll be fine.The only cons to this camera that I've found are as follows: At times the autofocus focuses on objects that I don't want to be the focus of the picture, and I have to test the focus a couple times to get a particular shot to work out. But, after having used several autofocus cameras, I suspect this is common to just about all digital, autofocus units out there. Also, it's quite possible that I have something set incorrectly on the camera itself and that could be causing some of the problem. This camera allows you the ability to change many settings to achieve almost any effect you could want. However the instruction manual does leave a bit to be desired (don't they all), so you have to play around with this to see what it can do.As some people have noted, because it runs on AA batteries instead of a lithium or other battery type, recovery time for the flash is longer, and often takes several seconds. So, if you're someone who tends to take a lot of high-speed, action shots where every second counts and a delay is liable to cost you the perfect shot, then this camera might not be for you, and you may wish to invest in something more pricey or something that uses a different kind of battery. If, however, you want something that will take fantastically clear and vivid pictures of people, objects, and anything else ordinary you can think of and that's ready to go right out of the box in a hurry, this camera is for you. Basically you have to weigh the pros and cons of being able to use easily obtainable disposable batteries versus the loss of speed involved when using such batteries, and compare this to your needs. In my opinion, this is one of the best cameras you will find anywhere in this price range, it takes incredible pictures on the fly, and has a lot of extra, advanced settings too boot. If you're planning to be a professional photographer and use a camera for business, there are probably better models out there; alternatively, if you just need a camera to capture quality moments in your life as they unfold, this is the one for you. Don't think twice about getting this, because it's fantastic.The only recommendation I have is that you buy a separate memory card for this camera, 4GB or better capacity. The card that comes with the camera holds only a few pictures, and isn't very useful for storage if you're going to take more than six photos at a time. With a 4GB memory card, I believe the camera will hold about 700 pictures at ultra high res, (which is about 4MB/picture) or about 1,500 photos at the fine setting, which is about 3mb/picture.

Reviews.Title: Old but perferred!
Reviews.Author: Super Sarah
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a birthday present a few years ago. I've enjoyed thiscamera so much, I love its focus and flash is great. It takes Batteries which Ilove because I hate having to charge a camera because when your out and aboutyou cant replace the battery as easily unless you have another pack. The onething I wish this camera had was better video zoom, its a bad quality zoom butif you take a normal video with no zooming then it works perfect. I love thiscamera so much, I recently took it to the beach and got sand in the lens, now itrefuses to work and I am currently researching for a new one. I can not find acamera that matches this one or that is better then this camera without payingmore then $300 for it. I actually just want to buy the same camera again becauseI love it so much

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: King Lou
Reviews.Content: This is not an ultra-compact, but small enough for easy transport.  Can be put in pants pocket.  6x zoom and image stability awesome!  Great photos for the price; obviously cannot compete for picture quality with high-end expensive cameras.  Great for everyday use.  Versatile.  Easy to use.  Only negative is the flash has a long recharge time between pics... something like 6-7 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Good image quality but....
Reviews.Author: Wayne Guerrini
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from an OLD HP camera I had for years.This looked like a great camera.  But it's comes with a very thick user's guide, and was quite daunting.  The symbols used in the printed manual are VERY hard to decipher/read. So a magnifying glass is quite useful.  Yes I have 20/20 vision corrected by glasses.The most disappointing thing about this camera, seems to be reliability.  I have had the camera a little over a year, and it has been in the shoppe twice for the same repair, plus a couple of new ones.  Fortunately repairs are under warranty, but its a 2+ week cycle for repairs.  As a photojournalist, a reliable camera is a must.  This has proven not so reliable unfortunately.So waiting for it to be repaired and returned as I start the new year.Hope the second time does the trick.Wayno

Reviews.Title: Cannon Camera
Reviews.Author: Dev
Reviews.Content: This is a really good camera.Pros:- Photo quality is awsome. The videos are far better then any other camera I had. It is so simple even my kids can handle it.Cons:- The shutter speed is really slow. It is solid 4-5 secs between 3 picture no matter how much u adjust the speed.The battery lid cannot take too much impact. If you drop the camera once or twice then the lid hinge gets loose and it won't hold the battery weight, you need to press the lid with your thumb in order to have the power.Overall a really good buy...

Reviews.Title: Great camera all around!
Reviews.Author: Matthew Victoreen
Reviews.Content: A great camera all around, and it takes really nice videos too! It is very easy to use, and I purchased it because consumer reports magazine gives it a good rating.

Reviews.Title: Faulty battery sensor/indicator
Reviews.Author: T. O Rice "timr688"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago and like it so much I bought one for my father also.  I did a lot of reading of point-and-shoot cameras and found this was rated high for picture quality.  It really does take great pictures.Now the problem.  My father began to complain that he was going through a lot of batteries, which puzzled me because my camera seemed to take forever to burn through a pair.  Sure enough, after a few months mine started doing the same thing.  I'd put batteries in and in an hour the camera's low battery indicator would come on. So I started pitching the batteries and putting in fresh ones.  I had to carry a pack of batteries any time I wanted to use the camera. My father bought rechargeables.Eventually I bought a battery tester.  Sure enough, the batteries were showing full except when I put them in the camera.  The camera's low battery indicator would come on and the camera would shut off.  I'd test the batteries and they were fully charged.I've seen other people posting about poor battery life for this model and can only imagine the thousands upon thousands of fully charged batteries people have been throwing away for nothign.  All that money wasted.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy S.
Reviews.Content: When my first A2000IS went into the pool "accidentally" I searchedand found another one immediately.  Very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Fan
Reviews.Author: Dicky G "infantryman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this one to replace the beloved A 720 I drowned when I fell into a lake in Desolation Wilderness.I have been especially impressed with the A 2000's more compact size -- even while it retains most of the features that so endeared me to the predecessor.- I especially like the big ZOOM, the high pixels, the ample screen, the ability to use rechargable off-the-shelf batteries.- I'm still getting used to the new proportions of the pictures and the lack of a viewfinder.Strongly recommend this camera for any avid gran'pa's general-purpose, high-volume use on smaller, constantly-moving subjects.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: C. DiMola "Mom of two boys"
Reviews.Content: I am really surprised at all the reviews saying that the pictures are crystal clear! My outdoor pictures come out fine, but my indoor pictures are horrible! The people look fake, like plastic dolls. Faces look shiney and strange. I absolutely hate this camera, and I don't know why everyone likes it so much. What is everyone else doing differently? I have 4 small children, and all of their pictures of them growing up are horrible. Maybe I just got a bad camera?

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Jim9500
Reviews.Content: Ater having other more expensive cameras that didn't seem to last much over a year and them having those rechargeable batteries I love the way this camera takes really good pictures and with some good double AA's it is always ready to work.Jim

Reviews.Title: love Canon but not too excited about this one
Reviews.Author: TA Mom
Reviews.Content: Honestly I may be unfairly comparing this with my Canon A630 which I just loved and which broke when I dropped it.Compared to that one (which used 4 AAs, this one which uses 2 AAs), the battery life is way too short.  I'm chewing through batteries at a distressing rate.There is sometimes a really long wait after you take a picture, before you can take your next one.I sometimes find the viewfinder (hope I am using the right term) hard to use.That said, perhaps some of this could be solved by changing some settings.  I have always loved my Canon purchases thus far (4-in-1 printer and 2 cameras) and picture quality, price and customer service are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best one I have ever owned. The pictures are crystal-clear.  I took a picture of my son spraying me with the water hose and the camera captured each individual twinkling droplet of water as well as his ornery face behind the water.  This camera is light-weight and easy to use. I love the zoom-quality, too. Pictures that I take far away are just as clear as ones up close. The price is great, too.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely great
Reviews.Author: YuliaATL "just a reader"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera solely for one purpose - to make pictures of my jewelry that I sell. This is the only camera in this price range that has a micro option. Absolutely great close ups. Will recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: small and impressive
Reviews.Author: James Ellis
Reviews.Content: I've only had this a short time, but I'm not new to digital photography. I bought this after a lot of research. I wanted a smaller camera because I just didn't want to lug my sx10is around all the time. What I wanted was good picture quality. This little camera is a gem. I am absolutely impressed with how good the pictures really are. It's a point and shoot with point and shoot limitations. Sure, it's missing manual controls but, I really don't care. I just wanted simplicity, a smaller & lighter camera that takes decent pictures. I got everything I was looking for. When using flash, it is slow for the next picture but, that's not unusual in cameras like these. I ran into the same situation when I used point and shoot film cameras. So, this was no surprise to me, and it's acceptable for me. The video should not be zoomed as digital zoom just plain stinks. The colors are more saturated in this camera I notice. The contrast is bumped up a notch higher too. In bright sunny days, I like that. I haven't done much in dimmer lighting yet, so I'm curious as to how those colors may act since saturation is up. If I see a problem, I can always switch to the program mode, then switch "my colors" to "Neutral." That should calm over saturation down. I'll have to wait and see. I always set the focus to center. That seems to work the best for me. I do the same with my sx10. I'm not impressed with face detection. What I can't seem to see any differences is in the auto vs. easy mode. I even put my bifocals back on. Does anyone see any difference between the "easy" and "auto" mode? Over all, for the money, I think this takes wonderful snap shots. Clear. Colorful. No purple tint/fringing. It's a nifty lightweight easy to use camera that really does a fine job. I think a lot of people who just want nice pictures will love this camera. When I give this a wirl at night, I'll update this post and give you the good or bad news. Reading the manual to all cameras several times is just so important. I take it with me. I'm not ashamed to read it out in public. I want my pictures to look as good as they can. Understanding how my camera works is just so worth learning. I can take beautiful pictures because there is more to a camera tha the "auto" mode.

Reviews.Title: good camera, good price
Reviews.Author: Davey Jones
Reviews.Content: I had bought a Nikon 620 camera last year. I was impressed with the size, but not the quality of the picture. Any pictures that were taken in not well lit areas came out orange in color. This past month I dropped it and it broke. Not happy about looking for another camera, but came across this one. I had a canon previous to my Nikon experience. Saw it for $169 on amazon, but found it at Walmart for $159. Camera works great. The picture quality is very good. I do see the pictures that are farther away and not for example outside, are sometime on the grainy side. Seems to be normal for the lower end digital cameras. I am also pleased with the video that can be taken. I didn't expect that I would be able to zoom when recording, but was pleased when it did. This feature is very good. Again on the Nikon it would do this but in steps, jumping. The Canon is very smooth, with no jumping. The camera is a bit bulky, with the AA batteries, and large 3" screen, but seems well built, with features that I can enjoy. I do wish that the SD card was not in the same location as the batteries. Open the door and the batteries come out, in order to take the card out.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A2000IS
Reviews.Author: Ray C. Overstreet "RayO"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife's birthday. It was competitively priced,well packaged and shipped promptly. She is very pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good for a Simple Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Marshall
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon Powershot SX10 IS as my main camera, but I wanted a smaller, less-complicated camera that I could throw into my bag and take with me and to take to the hospital when our second son is born. I did a lot of homework and I ended up with the A2000. So far, I've been happy with my purchase, but it does have it's issues. On Auto Mode, the flash takes FOREVER to charge back up, but I have found that switching to the nifty Easy Mode makes it charge faster. Also, I have heard that this camera eats alkaline batteries up pretty quick, so I prepared for that by purchasing some extra rechargeables. I have taken quite a few pictures and videos on the same set of batteries and haven't had to charge them yet, so I definitely recommend doing the same - along with carrying extras with you on outings. I haven't printed any of the photos I took as of yet, but they look decent on my computer screen. This camera is rather lean when it comes to features, but that's exactly what I was looking for. A couple nice features are, as I stated before, the Easy Mode and the Automatic Eye Correction, since most of my pictures are of my 20-month-old son, who moves constantly and is hard to capture. Another issue I had was extreme graininess in higher ISO settings, but I was willing make the sacrifice and use the flash in low-light situations. This camera is compact, but not ultra-compact. It is bulkier than a lot of other pocket cameras out there. I had the opportunity to buy an ultra-compact camera, but found it hard to use, so the A2000 works perfect for me and my big, clumsy hands.Pros: Simple, sturdy, and under $200.Cons: Eats batteries, graininess in higher ISO settings, and incredibly slow flash recharge time.Bottom Line: It's not perfect, but you get what you pay for - a simple digital camera from Canon. I feel for it's price, it's worth dealing with some of the issues.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Eric Miller
Reviews.Content: I love my Canon Powershot A2000IS!  I like it so much that we are now on our third one.  The previous two cameras met an early demise having nothing to do with the camera quality...that is unless you count dog chewing resistance as a ratable quality.I/we are not professional, advanced amateurs or otherwise photographers aspiring to be the next Ansel Adams of the pocket camera class.  Therefore, this camera has done everything we have asked, keeping in mind that it isn't a digital SLR.  We have taken it hiking, which is convenient because it fits nicely in a pocket and is quite durable.  As for the battery life, we use lithium batteries and they last many times longer than the standard alkaline batteries, even when using the flash.  I put in an 8 GB memory card and have an  essentially unlimited number of pictures along with more than 30-minutes of video time.  The picture quality is fantastic.The only reason I didn't grade this camera as 5 stars is due to the fact that at times it does have a longer than desired recovery time after taking a flash, and the 3-inch display can be a bit challenging to see when outdoors in bright sunlight.  I am not sure what is going on inside the camera but at times it will take several seconds after taking a photo before the camera is ready to take the next.  This happens very infrequently and has not been a big problem.Overall I would buy this camera again...and have.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING Price/Value Ratio !!!!
Reviews.Author: Miguel A. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Every day they make them more affordable and with more high end features, you can't go wrong with CANON

Reviews.Title: Great camera for multi use and video
Reviews.Author: Fishgriller "Kurt Ploetz"
Reviews.Content: Canon Powershot A2000IS 10MP Digital CameraI have been using this camera for my video review and it works as good as most video cameras.Check out the quality on the review of the Camp Chef SPG-90B Big Gas 3 Sports Grill, Black/RedI used quality of video to medium to fit the size standards on Amazon.PROS:  Great video quality  Easy to use  Easy to change functions and formats  Uses SD card which are super cheap  No shutter lag, way faster than my HP or Nikon  fits great in my handsCONS:  Battery life is average  small on/off button is hard to pushOverall:  Buy one for anyone who needs a good camera for moving objects and doesn't want to buy a separate video camera.  I use it on a tripod or just on the fly.CHECK IT OUT...Chef Kurt fishgriller

Reviews.Title: Good camera for in-between folks
Reviews.Author: Rebecca C.
Reviews.Content: I bought this little guy a year ago because of the 6x optical zoom. As always, Canon makes excellent products that produce excellent quality photos. This camera gave me what the smaller Elf series cameras didn't - lots of optical zoom! It has an "easy mode" that was way too basic so I never used it, as well as an Auto mode and special Program mode. Because I don't like the way flash makes photos look, I would set my P mode to a high ISO and turn off the Flash. Of course, the pictures came out granier the higher I made the ISO, but that's to be expected. I preferred it over having to deal with overexposed camera flashes (I think most compact cameras, at least, produce photos that are overexposed when using flash).Sadly, I broke it from what I consider a minor drop to the thinly carpeted floor. The body near the shutter button got a crack in it which caused the zoom-out, power button, and flash to stop working. FORTUNATELY I had purchased the accidental damage from handling coverage from the site where I bought the camera (D3LL) and they are sending me a refund. I will not re-purchase this camera, instead I want to try one thats either bigger or smaller, this guy is kind of a hybrid child of sorts, not as easy in the hands as an Elf or a bigger SLR-style camera.Who is this good for?Someone who...-Wants more zoom-Wants more features to tinker with-Not for super professional photography enthusiasts (just invest in a super camera)

Reviews.Title: Needs a view finder
Reviews.Author: wouldworker
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera.  Best zoom I have ever used on a point-and shoot and the image stabilization if a life saver.  My only objection is lack of a viewfinder.  The large view screen is great in most situations, but when the sun is bright or shining on the screen, it is useless.  At that point, I zoom out to ensure getting all the subject and crop on the computer later.  That said, this is a wonderful camera for the money.  I still recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: I love my new Cannon Powershot A2000IS
Reviews.Author: Susan Bellville
Reviews.Content: I really like the compact size, it fits neatly in my purse or pocket.  The picture quality is exceptional.  My previous camera was a Cannon Powershot and when I decided to get a new one (the old one still works just fine), I wanted to stick with a Cannon because of the ease of operation and my familiarity with the Cannon program on my computer.  I did run into one problem, I had planned on using the Cannon program that was already installed on my computer, but it wouldn't accept the photos from the new camera (more pixels), so I had to download the new program that came with the camera and I am having a hard time with creating new folders for my photos and finding the edit screen to crop and save.

Reviews.Title: Teenage Angst!!!
Reviews.Author: Digman
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon A2000IS for my teenage daughter to replace a Nikon Coolpix that had lens problems due to cheap plastic gear construction. (Nikon will repair the camera while under warranty but as soon as the warranty expires, you're on your own. They want to charge you even though it was repaired previously under their warranty. Goodbye, Nikon)After much searching and consultation with my daughter we/I decided on the Canon A2000IS because it offers more for the price. The major factors in the decision, other than price, were Canon quality (I own two Canons) and the size of the zoom. My daughter was apprehensive because she thought the camera was "ugly" and too big. The camera arrived just in time for her to take to a "Jonas Brothers" concert. She returned from the concert exclaiming, "This camera is amazing".She is happy with the picture quality, battery life, speed, and zoom. The flash recharge is a little slow, but she doesn't seem to mind. She does wish it was a little smaller so she could carry it in her pocket. The memory card that is included by Canon is way too small and is only sufficient to test the camera. Hello, Canon it would only cost a few dollars more to include a functional card. I immediately up graded the memory card to a faster and larger 8Gb.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for standard everyday usage
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Pros:Nice price, easy-to-use (both camera and software), convenient in hand, small size.Better zoom and response times than on my previous camera. Cons:Hard to see the screen in bright daylight. And no viewfinder to compensate this.Less settings (presets) than on my previous Powershot A85 (and sometimes I really miss them).Image quality rapidly drops in low-light scenes (dim indoor light, night scenes outdoors). And not much presets to compensate this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Wickman "Wickie76"
Reviews.Content: First off, I love the camera. Very easy to use with some simple adjustability built in. Like a lot of others had posted, if you want more complicated features, buy an SLR. I also like the fact that the camera can basically critique your pics, letting you know if it is under or overexposed. As far as portability, I upgraded from an A85, so this is much smaller and fits in my pocket just fine. One minor complaint which others had mentioned was the slow recovery time after flash, but what do you expect for using two double-A's, which by the way, you can pick up anywhere in an emergency unlike a lot of other cameras. Some complained about the write speed. I purchased a SanDisk 4GB SDHC Memory Card and have had no problems with the write speed. I didn't care for the fact that to get to the memory card, you have to open the battery compartment. You can transfer pics to the cpu via usb cable, but I also use this camera to check the pics from my trail cam in the field. So all in all I think this is a great camera for the price and would recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly but disappointed with flash recharge time
Reviews.Author: H. Ilani
Reviews.Content: Camera works perfectly in all aspects, but the flash recovery time is disappointing. It takes atleast 4 to 5 seconds with eneloop rechargeable batteries and some photo size settings. Over all a good camera if you take few pictures at night

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Laura J. Griffith "Laura"
Reviews.Content: It's wonderful and I can actually use it, and not screw it up.  YEAH!

Reviews.Title: Love the clarity of pictures!
Reviews.Author: CRCShops
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with 10MP after coping with a 4MP!  I love the added clarity this one provides.  The only negative thing I notice is, with my former camera, I had the capability of cropping a picture I was viewing.  This camera allows you to zoom while looking at the pictures, but I have not been able to crop the zoomed picture.  I've read the book and don't see that feature.  Of course, I'll continue to use it, and I'm glad I found this on Amazon.com.  I saved $30 over Wal-mart--exact same camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: Dirk Diggler "Huh?"
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, bought to share with the family and everyone is able to use it and get good shots.  Have it on vacation next couple weeks and taking lots of great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Works Well, Wish There is a View Finder
Reviews.Author: Dr. David J. Liu
Reviews.Content: The camera works well in both photo and video mode.  The price is right.The LCD screen can be hard to view outdoor.  Large range of optical zoom is the deciding factor in my choice, and it proved its value, especially with the help of image stablization.Overall, a good choice for casual users.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Ed Pollock
Reviews.Content: One of the latest versions of the never ending upgrade projects.  This was purchased as a gift for a family member.  Purchase was primarily based on the reputation and past use of the Canon product line.  So far all is good, great optics, ease of use, battery life, etc.

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera I've purchased
Reviews.Author: Aparna Bapu
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is small, takes great resolution photos, is very easy to use (especially having had a Canon camera before), the screen is large.  This was the most sensible digital camera I have looked at or purchased for my needs.  After my last camera became obsolete since I could no longer find lithium ion batteries for it, I wanted a camera that used AA batteries.  I cannot appreciate this camera anymore than I already do.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: J. Grau
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera after other family members had bought it.  We tried theirs out and liked it very much, so we bought our own.  We have been very happy with it, and it takes wonderful pictures for us as a family camera.

Reviews.Title: works great ...... great for carrying with you everywhere
Reviews.Author: R. Conn "mistahdood"
Reviews.Content: for the price could not have gone wrong by getting the canon i reviewed many before making the choice of going with another canon camerathis camera replaced a older model which the lense quit working  i was thinking of going with a different brand until reading the reviews on the ones i wanted and decided for the price i could not go wrong by getting the canon

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A2000IS
Reviews.Author: R.F. "Be the change"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Canon Powershot A2000S digital camera. I find it to be very easy to use and the instructions are easy to understand. I was surprised to see how great the pictures came out. The camera is great with downloading on the computer. Again, very easy to use. I am pleased with the camera and am glad I purchased it. Since I have nor had any photography experience, this camera was just the thing for me because it is so simple to use. I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants to have fun taking pictures without the hassle of trying to figure out how to use a camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: M. Hancock
Reviews.Content: Have had great results from this camera.  Have not see any problems with flash recharge time.  Takes crystal clear pics and great video.

Reviews.Title: This Canon is a Dud
Reviews.Author: Susannah 111
Reviews.Content: I've been shooting with Canon digital cameras for years, even though their lenses tend to get stuck after a while. So I invested in this one as soon as it came out. Big mistake: When the flash is on, it takes more than 5 seconds to shoot pictures in sequence. So if you're trying to take animal pictures, or even pictures of kids, the moment will be lost.I do give the camera 2 stars for the nice  big screen and the on-screen display that lets you know  what mode you're in.Also, I highly recommend dealing with 17th Street Photo through  Amazon (or, if you're in NYC, in person). The guys are great to deal with.

Reviews.Title: get over yourselves!!!! this is a great camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Ard
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why some of you are being so harsh on this camera. I think it is an absolute great camera and I have no regrets buying it. I have taken some absolutely beautiful pictures with this and cannot think of one thing that i do not like about it. Its easy to operate, it takes beautiful pictures, what else do you need? Some of you act as though you are in photography school. If that is the case, then you are probably right. This camera is not for you. For the rest of us who want a nice camera to capture vacations and memorable events (or just everyday life), then there is absolutely nothing wrong with this camera. So to those of you who saw the 2 star rating and was like "wow" i should not purchase this camera. Do not pay them any attention. They have too much time on their hands and need to realize that the majority of us are not looking for a camera to capture a butterfly's backside 2.4 miles away. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: LCD screen
Reviews.Author: K. Weaver
Reviews.Content: Very good camara but without a viewfinder it is almost impossible to use in sunlight because you cannot see the lcd window. Now looking for some kind of shade that will work.

Reviews.Title: Delay between pictures is 10-12 sec with the flash
Reviews.Author: J. Martin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my beloved Canon A95 wore out after years of vigorous use.  I was attracted to the 6X zoom on this camera and the fact that the reviews said it had the hallmark canon picture quality.  I expected to be happy with it.  I am accustomed to the normal delay between pictures with point and shoot digital camera, especially with the flash.  This camera takes 10-12 seconds in between pictures when you use the flash!  The majority of my pictures are of my young kids - they are NOT going to wait that long in between pictures!!If you are going to use the camera in setting where speed is not an issue, then I'd recommend this camera.  If you want to take pictures of your kids, look for a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product, Great price!
Reviews.Author: Lisa A. "Lisa and Michael"
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Canon.  Before the A2000 I owned a Powershot A80.  I knew right away what brand I would buy next.  So far it has given me great shots, very detailed and clear.  Having cats that move a lot and a child that does the same the feature "kids & pets" works great.  No more red demon eyes or glowing eyes from my cats.  Although on my older camera it had a fold out window to view which was very convenient for taking self pics and plus keeping the screen from getting damaged however the 3" screen is amazing and great for seeing every shot perfectly before you shoot.  The overall smaller size of the new camera verses the old is ok I guess.  I kinda of miss the right hand gripping feature a little.  Other than that I couldn't be more happy about it.  Some people have said that the lag between each picture is long but I don't see much of a problem with it.  Maybe try replacing batteries (I use rechargeable) and moving down the picture view time to 2 secs.  Also, seeing as this camera runs over $200 at local retailers the deal for $165 on Amazon was great.  I also purchased an 8GB card and I got everything for under $190 all including shipping.  I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but just to slow.
Reviews.Author: B. Holstine
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera and had it for a very short time before I sent it back for a refund. This camera has a really nice set up like all the rest of the A Series. I had problems with two things. The first being the amount of time between pictures. When I took a picture the screen would show the picture you took (I had it set on 2 sec reveal) and then the screen would go black until the next picture could be taken (took quit a few seconds to clear).
